title: Augusta County: Annie A. Dunn to Samuel Hunt, March 1, 1866
summary: Due to illness, Dunn was unable to make an official report on the status of her school in the month of January. In this letter, she explains that she has regained her health and provides an update on her recent classroom activities. In the conclusion of her letter, Dunn comments on her dissatisfaction with the removal of William L. Coan from his position with the AMA in Virginia.
keywords: African Americans, Education, Women, Race Relations, American Civil War
